title: Packaging waste registration (England, Scotland and Wales)

details.description: You need to register your business if you have a turnover of £2 million and handle more than 50 tonnes of packaging per year.
details.licence_short_description: Register your business if you have a turnover of £2 million and handle more than 50 tonnes of packaging per year.
details.licence_overview:
If your business has a turnover of more than £2 million and handles more than 50 tonnes of packaging in a calendar year you must comply with certain packaging waste obligations.

You can either meet your obligations individually or use a compliance scheme to help you meet them.

If you register with a compliance scheme they will take on your recycling and recovery obligations. You will need to pay them a fee and supply them with any relevant information that they require, such as the amount of packaging you handle.

If you choose to meet your obligations individually you will need to register with the Environment Agency in England and Wales or the Scottish Environment Protection Agency (SEPA) by 7 April of the year in which the obligations are to apply to your business.

You must also show that you have met your recycling and recovery targets as calculated under schedule 2 of the Producer Responsibility Obligations (Packaging Waste) Regulations 2005.

Fines and penalties

If you fail to comply, you will be fined up to £5,000 in a magistrates’ court or an unlimited fine in the Crown Court.
